Based on my search results, here's the information about the Avatar movie release date for 2025 and James Cameron's sequel:

## Avatar 3: Fire and Ash - December 19, 2025

The next Avatar sequel, officially titled "Avatar: Fire and Ash," is scheduled to be released on December 19, 2025. This is the third installment in James Cameron's Avatar franchise, following the success of "Avatar: The Way of Water" which was released in 2022.

## Key Details:

**Official Title**: Avatar: Fire and Ash

**Director**: James Cameron, who co-produced, co-edited, and directed the film

**Release Delays**: The film experienced several delays due to the COVID-19 pandemic and the 2023 strikes in Hollywood, pushing the release from the originally scheduled December 2024 to December 2025

**New Elements**: The film will introduce a new group called the Ash People, and the Wind Traders, who travel the skies in balloon-like airships

**Runtime**: Cameron confirmed that Movie 3 will actually be a little bit longer than Movie 2 (which was 3 hours 12 minutes)

**Trailer Release**: The trailer was officially released exclusively in theaters before screenings of The Fantastic Four: First Steps and online on July 28, 2025

This will be the third of five planned Avatar films, with Avatar 4 currently set to release in December 2029 and Avatar 5 following in 2031.

message.content: what features are expected in Angular 21

input.query: Angular 21 features release date 2025 new functionality

content.content:

Links: [{"title":"Angular 20 - What’s New - Angular.love","url":"https://angular.love/angular-20-whats-new/"},{"title":"Roadmap • Angular","url":"https://angular.dev/roadmap"},{"title":"Versioning and releases • Angular","url":"https://angular.dev/reference/releases"},{"title":"Angular Blog","url":"https://blog.angular.dev/announcing-angular-v20-b5c9c06cf301"},{"title":"Releases · angular/angular","url":"https://github.com/angular/angular/releases"},{"title":"What’s new in Angular 20.0? | Ninja Squad","url":"https://blog.ninja-squad.com/2025/05/28/what-is-new-angular-20.0/"},{"title":"What’s Coming in Angular 20?","url":"https://medium.com/@sehban.alam/whats-coming-in-angular-20-7762cfd21d9f"},{"title":"Angular","url":"https://v17.angular.io/guide/releases"},{"title":"What's New in Angular 20: Features, Updates & Improvements","url":"https://radixweb.com/blog/what-is-new-in-angular-20"},{"title":"Angular (web framework) - Wikipedia","url":"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Angular_(web_framework)"}]

Based on the search results, here's what I found about Angular 21 features, release date, and new functionality for 2025:

## Angular 21 Release Information

Official support for HammerJS is deprecated and will be removed in a future major release – angular 21. This indicates that Angular 21 will include the removal of HammerJS integration as a major breaking change.

## Current Angular 20 Status (May 2025)

Angular 20.0.0 is here and Angular 20.0 is expected in the week of May 26, 2025. Angular 20 has already been released in May 2025 with significant features including:

- Zoneless change detection is the future of Angular change detection. Zoneless is no longer experimental, but not yet stable. It is now in developer preview and, to reflect that, the provider has been renamed from provideExperimentalZonelessChangeDetection to provideZonelessChangeDetection.
- The structural directives ngIf, ngFor and ngSwitch are now officially deprecated in favor of the control flow syntax.
- In Angular v20 we graduated all the fundamental reactivity primitives to stable including signal, effect, linkedSignal, signal-based queries, and inputs.

## Expected Angular 21 Features and Timeline

Based on Angular's typical release schedule, Angular 21 would be expected around **November 2025** (approximately 6 months after Angular 20's May 2025 release).

### Key Features Expected in Angular 21:

1. **HammerJS Removal**: The HammerJS integration has been deprecated. HammerJS has not been updated for the past 8 years so the team is planning to remove all HammerJS entities from the framework in the future.

2. **Signal-based Forms**: Angular is exploring signal-based forms, with Angular 20 likely introducing an experimental API. Based on the 2024 survey and 2025 roadmap, this approach aims to become the new default for form management.

3. **Selectorless Components**: Angular 20 might introduce selectorless components, aiming to eliminate double imports and simplify component usage. While an RFC is planned for 2025, an experimental version in Angular 20 is possible.

4. **Stable Zoneless Change Detection**: Given that zoneless is currently in developer preview in Angular 20, it may reach stable status in Angular 21.

Note that specific Angular 21 features haven't been officially announced yet, as the Angular team typically focuses on the current and immediate next release. The information above represents the current trajectory and planned deprecations that will likely be completed in Angular 21.

## Angular 21 Release Information

Official support for HammerJS is deprecated and will be removed in a future major release – angular 21. This indicates that Angular 21 will include the removal of HammerJS integration as a major breaking change.

## Current Angular 20 Status (May 2025)

Angular 20.0.0 is here and Angular 20.0 is expected in the week of May 26, 2025. Angular 20 has already been released in May 2025 with significant features including:

- Zoneless change detection is the future of Angular change detection. Zoneless is no longer experimental, but not yet stable. It is now in developer preview and, to reflect that, the provider has been renamed from provideExperimentalZonelessChangeDetection to provideZonelessChangeDetection.
- The structural directives ngIf, ngFor and ngSwitch are now officially deprecated in favor of the control flow syntax.
- In Angular v20 we graduated all the fundamental reactivity primitives to stable including signal, effect, linkedSignal, signal-based queries, and inputs.

## Expected Angular 21 Features and Timeline

Based on Angular's typical release schedule, Angular 21 would be expected around **November 2025** (approximately 6 months after Angular 20's May 2025 release).

2. **Signal-based Forms**: Angular is exploring signal-based forms, with Angular 20 likely introducing an experimental API. Based on the 2024 survey and 2025 roadmap, this approach aims to become the new default for form management.

3. **Selectorless Components**: Angular 20 might introduce selectorless components, aiming to eliminate double imports and simplify component usage. While an RFC is planned for 2025, an experimental version in Angular 20 is possible.

content.text:
Angular 21 is expected around November 2025. Key anticipated features include:

- **HammerJS removal** (officially deprecated, will be removed)
- **Stable zoneless change detection** (currently developer preview in Angular 20)
- **Signal-based forms** (likely experimental or stable)
- **Selectorless components** (potentially experimental)
- **Complete migration away from structural directives** (ngIf, ngFor, ngSwitch deprecated in Angular 20)

Angular 21 specifics haven't been officially announced yet, as the team focuses on current releases.
